N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 613-8.4 - Allowable mechanisms and combinations of mechanisms

State Regulations
(a) A tank system owner or operator, including a local government tank system owner or operator, may use any one or
combination of the mechanisms listed under paragraphs (d)(1) through (7) of
this section to demonstrate financial responsibility under this Subpart for one
or more underground storage tanks. (b) A local government tank system owner or
operator may use any one or combination of the mechanisms listed under
paragraphs (d)(8) through (11) of this section to demonstrate financial
responsibility under this Subpart for one or more underground storage
tanks. (c) A tank system owner or
operator may use self-insurance in combination with a guarantee only if, for
the purpose of meeting the requirements of the financial test under this rule, the financial statements of the tank system owner or operator are not
consolidated with the financial statements of the guarantor. (d) Mechanisms of financial
responsibility. (1)

or operator, and/or guarantor must meet the criteria of subparagraph (ii) of
this paragraph based on year-end financial statements for the latest completed
fiscal year. (ii)

system owner or operator. If the guarantor fails to meet the requirements of

operator must obtain alternative coverage as specified in paragraph 8.7(c)(5)
